amendment.description: To increase the end strength of the Army and to structure the additional forces for constabulary duty.

vote.text: Amendment SA 1834 agreed to in Senate by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Motion by Senator Stevens to reconsider the vote by which amendment SA 1834 was not tabled (Roll Call Vote No. 382) withdrawn in Senate.
Motion by Senator Stevens to reconsider the vote by which amendment SA 1834 was not tabled (Roll Call Vote No. 382) entered in Senate.
Motion to table amendment SA 1834 rejected in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 45 - 52. Record Vote Number: 382.
Amendment SA 1834 proposed by Senator Reed. (consideration: CR S12525-12528; text: CR S12525) To increase the end strength of the Army and to structure the additional forces for constabulary duty.
Senate amendment agreed to: Amendment SA 1834 agreed to in Senate by Unanimous Consent.
Roll call votes on amendments in Senate: Motion to table amendment SA 1834 rejected in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 45 - 52. Record Vote Number: 382.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 1834 proposed by Senator Reed.
